properties.areaDesc: Winston, MS; Noxubee, MS; Kemper, MS; Neshoba, MS; Choctaw, MS
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 10 at 4:39PM CST until February 10 at 10:45PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southeastern Choctaw County in central Mississippi...
Noxubee County in east central Mississippi...
Kemper County in east central Mississippi...
Winston County in east central Mississippi...
Neshoba County in east central Mississippi...

* Until 1045 PM CST Monday.

* At 437 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated gauges indicated
thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Two to
four inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already
occurring.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Philadelphia, Louisville, Preston, Nanih Waiya, Pearl River,
Neshoba, Macon, Brooksville, De Kalb, Liberty, Millcreek, Tamola,
Damascus, Cooksville, Deerbrook, Bigbee Valley, Mashulaville,
Burnside, Gholson and Electric Mills.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to two inches are possible in the
warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 10:45 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
